column4: Am I in the right place for assistance w/Ubuntu dl and install?
the install image is just a bit over 700MB
open your webbrowsers downloads tool it should be listed there
the ubuntu.com website has screenshots with instructions for many common burning applications, nero is probably in that list
you might also check if there is a LUG (linux users group) in your area. they might be able to provide you with some known good install disks
what is saying it doesn't have 4.4GB?
if you posted a response, I missed it.
i was asking where are you getting this 4.4gb message. did you boot the install cd?

you would have to shrink the windows partition. if there is corruption on the windows (and you intend to keep the windows or keep its data) i would STRONGLY recommend booting a windows rescue CD and fixing the corruption PRIOR to resizing the partition
you could delete the windows partition, but you would lose all data on the computer
you can go to the livecd (try ubuntu now instead of install ubuntu) and maybe access files (unless the ntfs is too corrupted to even read
hit the windows key and type in a keyword for the program you want to run. like "disk" or "partition"
perhaps an older version of ubuntu fit within 4.4GB of free disk space, but not the modern ubuntu
hit the windows key and type some keyword like "partition" or "disk"
have you attempted what i told you to do?
